column4: how can i delete my current default kernel and make the second one my default again? (grub ...)
just sudo aptitude/apt-get remove it, grub will adjust itself
Find the running version. eg:  uname -r      then: sudo apt-get remove linux-image-<whatever uname -r reported here>
When it cleans up grun and removes the entry, the previous one becomes first to be loaded again
